content.description: Make the effort to get on this one you'll be glad you did. Pretty short route but it has as much or more great tufa pinching and laybacking as the best Tufa routes at the Homestead. The moves are cool from bottom to top. There is as much tufa climbing on this as any other tufa route. Starts on deep thin tufas, pulls a bulge/roof on some cauliflower stalagtites then continues up another deep thin tufa. Bolts are to the left at the top to keep them in good rock.It isn't long and the rock isn't as friendly as on some tufa routes but if you like tufa climbing you'll be glad you did this one.
content.location: The farthest left route on the Marley Wall. Hike to the Marley Wall then walk all the way left until you cannot go any farther. Single belay bolt is down and right of the first bolt.
To the right of Natural Mystic.

content.description: Climb big features through the bulge and continue up the face and arete above.
content.location: Just to the right of Ganja.

climbs.name: One Love
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers and Dave Stephens, December 2010.

content.description: You will love the hold used to clip the second bolt.  Hard moves past the tufas and a short thick stalagtite then face climbing to a popcorn filled corner.  Despite the popcorn I would climb it again.
content.location: On the left edge of Marley Wall.  Starts up on some tufa then pulls on a short stumpy stalagtite and tufas at a roof 10 feet up or so.

content.description: Face climbing to a steep dihedral.
content.location: About 100 feet to the right of Positive Vibration.

content.description:
The left line involves a fun series of moves up and past interesting flowstone features, although the finish is a bit of a letdown. Possibly not worth even one star, but cool enough to throw a rope on! 

 Good warm-up for Marley Wall
content.location: Just to the left of Buffalo Soldier are two, short routes, both ending on a ledge 40 feet up. This is the left of the two.

content.description: Probably the steepest route in the Homestead. Climb a short, white initial face before blasting up and right through the huge bulge on positive features. Finish up the slightly overhung face above.
content.location: Found just after the "down and around" trail to the Marley Wall.

content.description: Definitely the better of this pair of shorties, with good moves all the way to the anchors. Nice tufa features lead to a strenuous roof, followed by a classic “letter-box” slot that provides access to the final jugs. Avoid the skanky rock out left (above the roof) and climb directly up past the bolts (no difference in the grade, but much more aesthetic.)
content.location: Just to the left of Buffalo Soldier are two, short routes, both ending on a ledge 40 feet up. This is the right of the two.

content.description: Amazing tufa line gets progressively harder the higher you get. Be careful of the thin and delicate tufa near the end.
content.location: Left most route on the Marley Wall, left of Ganja.

content.description: The furthest wall from the parking.  South facing.  Keep hiking past Tufa City.
